breakfast.name: Raffles City Mall Food Court
breakfast.notes: Breakfast after observation deck visit. Multiple options available in mall food court. Convenient location.

lunch.name: Ju Fa Cai Chongqing Jianghu Cuisine
lunch.location: Daxi Lane 28, Yuzhong District (near Huguang Guild Hall)
lunch.notes: NO HOTPOT (saving for dinner). Authentic Jianghu dishes near Huguang Guild Hall. Popular local restaurant.

dinner.name: Qu Nanshan Yeqing Huoguo Gongyuan
dinner.notes: HILLSIDE HOTPOT WITH NIGHT VIEW (南山半山腰). Elevated location with panoramic Chongqing night view. Reservations recommended.

breakfast.name: Family Home
breakfast.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
breakfast.notes: Breakfast with family at home. Chinese New Year Eve preparations.

lunch.name: Family Home
lunch.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
lunch.notes: Family lunch. Chinese New Year Eve gathering.

dinner.name: Family Home - Chinese New Year Eve Dinner
dinner.location: Banshan Yicheng A District, Building 35, Unit 1902
dinner.notes: Chinese New Year Eve celebration dinner with family. Traditional reunion feast.

breakfast.name: Lao Wu Jiangrou Baozi
breakfast.notes: MUST-VISIT: Most authentic Bazhong breakfast. Famous sauce meat buns (酱肉包子). User-specified restaurant.

lunch.name: Lao Qi Niurou
lunch.notes: MUST-VISIT: Famous for Bazhong-style beef dishes. User-specified restaurant before train departure.

dinner.name: Qinshanzhai (钦膳斋)
dinner.location: 247 Wuhouci Avenue, Gaosheng Bridge, Wuhou District, Chengdu
dinner.notes: MATURE SICHUAN RESTAURANT near Jinli Ancient Street. Established restaurant with authentic Chengdu flavors. Open during Spring Festival (11:00-21:30). Reservations recommended. Famous for fish-flavored shredded pork (鱼香肉丝), kung pao chicken, and seasonal bamboo shoots. Walking distance from Jinli. Phone: 028-8505-3333. Verified via Google Maps (rating 4.4).

breakfast.name: Bǎ'èr Xiǎoqū Chāoshǒu (八二小区抄手) - Jianshe Road Flagship
breakfast.location: Building Road 6-8, Jianshe Road District, Chengdu (建中路6-8号)
breakfast.notes: LOCAL CHENGDU BREAKFAST: Famous for authentic Sichuan-style chāoshǒu (抄手/wontons). Flagship store near user's family home. Opens at 07:00, perfect for early breakfast before panda base visit. Rating: 4.6/5.0. Cost: ¥21 per person. Operating hours: 07:00-20:30 daily. Verified via Gaode Maps.

lunch.name: Mingting Xiaoguan (明婷小馆) - Taikoo Li Flagship
lunch.location: Dongda Street, Xiadongda Street No.166, 4th Floor, Chengdu (东大街下东大街166号4楼)
lunch.notes: ⚠️ CRITICAL TIMING: Restaurant opens at 11:00 AM (NOT before). User MUST arrive exactly at 11:00 opening time. Only 45-minute window before airport departure (high-risk schedule with zero margin for delays). Rating: 4.7/5.0. Cost: ¥75 per person. Operating hours: Regular 11:00-21:30, Spring Festival 11:00-23:00. Restaurant may need 5-10 minutes after opening for service readiness. Consider backup plan if delayed. Verified via Gaode Maps POI ID: B0KB17BRRJ.

dinner.name: Lao Gan Bei Shanghai Bund Flagship (老乾杯上海外滩本店)
dinner.location: Guangdong Road 20, Bund No. 5, 5th Floor, Huangpu District (广东路20号外滩5号5层)
dinner.notes: HIGH-QUALITY JAPANESE RESTAURANT AT BUND: Premium Japanese yakiniku (charcoal-grilled wagyu beef) at iconic Bund No. 5 location. Rating: 4.7/5.0 (highest rated option). Cost: ¥610 per person. Operating hours: 12:00-14:30, 17:00-22:00 daily. Sophisticated atmosphere perfect for couples. Specialty: Premium Japanese wagyu, teppanyaki, kaiseki courses. Reservations HIGHLY recommended - call ahead. Walking distance from Nanjing Road hotel (500m, 6-minute walk). Business area: Beijing Road (北京路). Verified via Gaode Maps POI ID: B0FFG7UM6X. NOTE: Part of renowned Taiwan Lao Gan Bei chain, Shanghai flagship at prestigious Bund No. 5 building.

breakfast.name: Always Coffee Roaster
breakfast.location: Jiujiang Road 501, Room 106, Huangpu District (near Nanjing East Road Metro Station Exit 4, 100m walk)
breakfast.notes: INFJ-FRIENDLY: Cozy specialty coffee shop near hotel. Perfect for morning coffee and light breakfast before city exploration. Convenient location for start of People's Square/Bund day. Verified via Gaode Maps POI ID: B0L6K9D71B.

lunch.name: Renheguan (人和馆) - Zaojiabang Road Branch
lunch.location: Zaojiabang Road 407, Xuhui District (230m walk from Jiashan Road Metro Station Exit 5)
lunch.notes: MICHELIN-RECOMMENDED: Authentic Shanghai local cuisine (本帮菜). Rating: 4.8/5.0. Cost: ¥186 per person. Operating hours: Mon-Fri 11:00-14:00, 17:00-21:30; Sat-Sun 11:00-14:00, 16:30-21:30. Famous for classic Shanghai dishes. Business area: Fenglin Road (枫林路). Verified via Gaode Maps POI ID: B0FFF407ML. Also available: Jing'an Temple Branch (静安寺店) at Yuyuan Road 142 if preferred.

dinner.name: AJIYA (AJIYA) - Jing'an Branch
dinner.location: Jiangning Road 445, Shimei Building 4F Room 402, Jing'an District
dinner.notes: USER-SPECIFIED RESTAURANT (Option 3/3): Premium Japanese yakiniku (charcoal grill). Rating: 4.5/5.0. Cost: ¥127 per person. Operating hours: 11:30-14:00, 17:00-23:00 (Spring Festival 2026-02-16 to 2026-02-21: 16:00-22:00). High-quality grilled meats. Reservations strongly recommended. Phone: 021 6446 9999. Verified via Gaode Maps POI ID: B0FFIVKQPF and Google Maps Place ID: ChIJEXBMOhlwsjURIlaJlMRNRIM.

notes: All restaurant recommendations verified via Gaode Maps POI search and Google Maps. Key highlights: (1) Day 1 Chongqing: Breakfast at Raffles City after observation deck, NO hotpot for lunch, HILLSIDE HOTPOT with night view at Nanshan (南山半山腰) for dinner. (2) Day 2 Bazhong: All family meals at home for Chinese New Year Eve. (3) Day 3: MUST-VISIT 老五酱肉包子 for breakfast and 老七牛肉 for lunch in Bazhong, dinner at QINSHANZHAI (钦膳斋) near Jinli Ancient Street - mature Sichuan restaurant replacing Taolin, verified open during Spring Festival. (4) Day 4 UPDATED (2026-02-05): Breakfast at 八二小区抄手 (Bǎ'èr Xiǎoqū Chāoshǒu) Jianshe Road flagship - famous local Sichuan wonton breakfast (opens 07:00, ¥21 per person, rating 4.6). Lunch at 明婷小馆 (Mingting Xiaoguan) Taikoo Li flagship - ⚠️ CRITICAL TIMING WARNING: Opens at 11:00 only, user must arrive exactly at opening, 45-minute window before airport departure, high-risk schedule with zero delay margin (¥75 per person, rating 4.7, verified via Gaode Maps POI ID B0KB17BRRJ). ⚠️ DINNER UPDATED (2026-02-05): Replaced Sichuan restaurant with HIGH-QUALITY JAPANESE at 老乾杯 (Lao Gan Bei) Shanghai Bund Flagship - premium Japanese yakiniku at iconic Bund No. 5, 5th floor (¥610 per person = $84 USD, rating 4.7 - HIGHEST RATED, Gaode POI ID: B0FFG7UM6X). Perfect location 500m from hotel, sophisticated atmosphere, specializes in premium wagyu beef and kaiseki courses. RESERVATIONS HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. (5) Day 5 UPDATED (2026-02-05): Breakfast at Always Coffee Roaster (specialty coffee near hotel). Lunch at 人和馆 (Renheguan) Zaojiabang Road branch - MICHELIN-RECOMMENDED Shanghai Benbang cuisine (¥186 per person, rating 4.8, Gaode POI ID: B0FFF407ML). Dinner at AJIYA Jing'an Branch - Japanese yakiniku (¥127 per person, rating 4.5, Gaode POI ID: B0FFIVKQPF, phone: 021 6446 9999). All three Day 5 dining options researched per user requirements (Michelin restaurant, Renheguan, Ajiya). Alternative Michelin options identified: Fu He Hui (vegetarian, rating 4.7), Yongfoo Elite (rating 4.1), Mr&Mrs Bund (rating 4.6). (6) Shanghai Days 5-7: Includes MICHELIN restaurants (人和馆 Benbang cuisine, AJIYA Japanese yakiniku, Bairong Shandong cuisine). (7) Beijing Days 8-21: Class schedule constraints on Tue/Wed/Thu (no far trips during day). University area restaurants near Tsinghua/Peking. Authentic Beijing experiences: copper pot hotpot (铜锅涮肉), zhajiangmian, roast duck. (8) Day 16: Optional Tianjin day trip with Tianjin specialties. (9) Day 20: Special farewell dinner for final night together. TOTAL ESTIMATED MEAL COST: Approximately 1,845 USD for 2 people over 21 days (excluding Day 2 family meals, updated after Day 4 dinner change from $13 to $84 = +$71 USD). RedNote verification attempted but MCP Playwright browser installation issues prevented search execution - recommend manual RedNote verification of Shanghai restaurants (search: '老乾杯 上海外滩', '人和馆 上海', 'AJIYA 上海') before booking. All costs are per-person estimates in USD converted from CNY at approximate rate of ¥7.25 = $1 USD.
